title: Bug 10403: Confirmation should be added when creating a project in an existing directory structure
OB: When a user creates a new project for an existing directory structure and points the output folder at a bin directory that contains more than just .class files, no confirmation message is displayed.
EB: A confirmation message should be displayed when creating a project in an existing directory structure, informing the user that the output directory will be deleted and rebuilt. This is necessary because some users are pointing the output folder at a bin directory which contains other files that can be rebuilt from the available .java files.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Open the project creation dialog.
2. Choose an existing directory structure that contains a bin folder.
3. Set the bin folder as the output directory.
4. Click on the 'Create Project' button.

Expected result:
A confirmation message should be displayed, informing the user that the output directory will be deleted and rebuilt.

Observed result:
No confirmation message is displayed and the project is created without any indication that the output directory will be scrubbed.
